derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French eternite, from Latin aeternitas, from aeternus 'without beginning or end' (see eternal)

entry.def: Eternity is time without an end or a state of existence outside time, especially the state which some people believe they will pass into after they have died.

example.ex: I have always found the thought of eternity terrifying.
example.tran: 我向来觉得永生的想法很可怕。

example.ex: ...laying him to rest for all eternity.

entry.tran: 极长的一段时间;似乎无穷尽的一段时间
entry.def: If you say that a situation lasted for an eternity, you mean that it seemed to last an extremely long time, usually because it was boring or unpleasant.

example.ex: The war continued for an eternity...
example.tran: 那场战争持续了极长的一段时间。

example.ex: The ringing went on for what seemed an eternity, and then someone answered.
example.tran: 电话响了似乎很长一段时间，然后有人接了电话。

means.word_mean: 2. a state of eternal existence believed in some religions to characterize the afterlife
